Html:
We know from C#, that property setters automatically get the parameter "value" handed over.
set Property() { this.property = value; }
this would save developers some time because we always have to write
set Property(value: PropertyType) { this.property = value; }
Are there any plans to implement this behavior into the compiler?
TypeScript uses the get/set approach from JavaScript (rather than C#). I suspect, since we're aligning with JavaScript, we won't add additional syntactic sugar like what C# provides.
